page.title: 11Chatteris - Horseway People
page.content:
Travelling up New Road there were orchards and strawberry fields. There was also a fever hospital on the outskirts of Chatteris for typhus and other diseases.
Chris Green, the son of the people who owned "The Farmer's Boy" was the only boy to be killed during the First World War, from the New Road area.
In 1942 during the Second World War, Henry Coulson bought the farm that became known as Coulson's Farm. After the war the land on both sides of New Road became largely used for the production of cash crops.
In the 1950's and 1960's the council built houses at Newlands and Queensway. In the 1970's a private estate, Green Park, was started.
